Documentation.UserDocu: Point in a Mesh This is a Point in a MeshObject. You can get it by e.g. iterating a Mesh. The point has a connection to its Mesh and allows therfore topological operations. Its also posible to creat a unboundet Mesh point e.g. to create a Mesh. In this case the Topological operations will fail. The same when you cut the bound to the Mesh by calling unbound().
methode unbound(void) Cut the conection to a Meshobject. The point becomes free and is more or less a simple vector/point. After call unbound() no topological operation will work!
methode move(Vector) This methode move the point in the Mesh allong the given Vector. This affects the topology of the mesh. Be aware that after moving point(s) the Mesh can have self intersections!
The index of this Point in the MeshObject
Normal vector of the point computed by the sourounding mesh.
